definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A nonrestrictive clause is separated from the main clause by a comma or commas.
sentences.chinese: 非限定用法的形容词子句与主句之间有加逗点分离。

sentences.english: Daniel Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注重标点，出格是逗点和句号的不错施用要领。

sentences.english: The comma shape is more pronounced in the large version of the image.
sentences.chinese: 在大图中，这种逗点形状表现的更加明显。

sentences.english: It was something to do with the question of whether commas should be placed inside brackets, or outside.
sentences.chinese: 大概同逗点应该放在括号内还是括号外的问题有关。

definition: Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
punctuation of a sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/period 句號|句号 and comma 逗號|逗号/sentences and phrases
